column1: back of a length and outside off, 129.7ks, leans back and chops the ball straight to point
short of a length on middle and leg, glanced away to long leg
short of a length and outside off, 132ks, Finch gently defends back to the bowler
uppish but through the gap at the covers. Just short of a good length and swings away outside off, Finch is up on his tippy toes as he punches it away
veering onto the pads, 133ks, Finch misses the flick, the ball rolls away to short fine leg
117.6ks, slower dipping yorker, on off stump, that's a Malinga special. Klinger squirts it back down the pitch
wayward start from Kulasekara. Full and angling down leg, wide
good length ball on off, tip-and-run single in front of cover
uppish and this slashed away to the left of backward point.  Back of a length and outside off, cut away
back of a length and outside off, carved away in the air to the left of point and to the right of third man
length ball, angled in, too straight, Finch gets inside the line and twirls his wrists, sending the ball away to the right of deep square leg
slightly back of a length and outside off, Finch chops to point
shorter and ducks back in from outside off, some extra bounce too for Kulasekara. Finch jumps off the ground and punchily plays to the covers
back of a length and outside off, chopped to extra-cover
full, angled into the right-hander, and then shapes away, opening 'em up. Swing for Sanjaya. Wafted towards point
Finch has a wry smile. Length and outside off, it jumps from there, thuds into the splice of the bat. Hangs in the air before dropping in front of Mendis at cover

No fireworks from Finch in front of his home fans. Sanjaya has his man. Good length ball, angled in and kicks up at the batsman again. Finch is early into the shot, looking to work to leg. He jumps off the ground, and ends up lobbing a return catch. This surface has something in it for the seamers
short of a length on middle, played back to the bowler
wicket-to-wicket line, Dunk presses forward and pats it to mid-off. Impressive over first-up from Sanjaya
full and drifting down leg for another leg-side wide
Klinger hares down the track, Kulasekara drags his length back outside off. Klinger does not have enough room for the cut. Drags an inside edge past the leg stump
shortish and outside off, chopped to point again
short and outside off, the shot was on. Width on offer, he cracks a cut between backward point and cover
full and outside off, opens the bat-face and dinks it to point
Dunk runs down the track, Kulasekara pulls his length back. Dunk says no problem and shovels it away with the bottom hand in the gap at midwicket. Skips away to the boundary
back of a length, starts on off and skirts away past the outside edge. Bad start, but good finish to the over from Kulasekara
full and outside off, Klinger drives crisply but can't beat Mendis at extra-cover. The off-side ring is well populated
Klinger uses his feet and aims to scythe it through the off side. This one seams away and whistles past the outside edge
length ball, angled in, dropped to point and Klinger rushes off to the other end. Puts pressure on the fielder. Kapu, I think, runs in and fumbles
Duck backs away outside off, full and wide outside off, scythed away over cover. Klinger pats Dunk on the back
back of a length and skids onto rap the thigh as Dunk does not connect with a pull. The ball rolls square on the off side
picked off the pads through backward square leg. Good Powerplay for Sri Lanka so far
short dart outside off, nearly 100ks, not much turn. Dunk hangs back and slashes it over the top of point. Evades the outstretched arm
straight ball, which is drilled to mid-off
Dunk makes room outside leg, opens up the off side. Takes this length ball from outside off and launches it over cover for a six
Dunk goes downtown now. Tossed up and outside off, Dunk moves away outside leg again. He smashes it disdainfully over the long-off fence. This Munaweera experiment has backfired for SL
99.5ks, skids on middle, gets forward and pushes to cover

half-tracker on leg or outside leg, Dunk ventures deep in the crease and swats a pull over midwicket for his third six in four balls. 22 off the last over of the Powerplay. And just like that Australia have scooted to 60
back of a length and angled in on off, clipped to deep square leg
full on the stumps, which is slapped away through the covers

slower cutter outside off, Klinger chops it more or less straight to point. He aims for a quick single, Dunk responds . He dishes out a full-length dive and is safe. Dunk is in by the time the keeper collects the throw and swipes the bails off

bowled'em. Just 88ks, the lack of pace does 'em in. Looks like another slower cutter, dips, creating distance between the bat and the pitch. Dunk aims a big swipe and does not touch it. Asela kisses the off stump
slower incutter, slower than the previous ball, 87ks, takes the inside edge and rolls away just wide of leg stump. Henriques played early and got away
floated on off, 86ks, patted to point inching forward. Just four off the over
full and outside off, eased through the covers on the front foot
tossed-up legbreak outside off, played with the turn to point with soft hands
shorter and spins away outside off, Klinger skips back, cuts, and can't beat point. He hasn't got going
skiddy legbreak outside off, sits back and punches in the gap at the covers
shorter and slides in with the arm outside off, Henriques forces to long-on on the back foot
back of a length and outside off, angles his bat and chops to backward point
floated up outside off, whipped on the back foot through midwicket. They aim two, some miscommunication between the wickets. No harm done for the hosts. They settle with one in the end
loopier and outside off, waits the ball to arrive, and then chips it up and over the covers
length and outside off, dragged with a slog-sweep to deep midwicket
length ball, floated on off, punched down the pitch past the bowler's right
floated up outside off, flicked away nicely into the vacant spaces at midwicket
Asela dives to his right, but the ball evades his outstretched right hand. Full and sticks in the surface, lobbed past the bowler
dug short and outside off, goes back and forces the ball to cover
slower legbreak thrown up wide outside off as Henriques steps out early. He is forced to reach out and slice it away between point and cover
turning legbreak outside off, why was Sandakan left out? what was Zampa left out? Slashes and misses as the ball slides past the bottom edge
short and outside off, laced off the back foot to long-off
another turning legbreak, this is short in length. Square-cut to deep point
half-tracker on middle, Klinger still can't get going. Skips back and pulls to deep midwicket
Klinger breaks free. Slower cutter outside off, he gets inside the line and laps it away fine of long leg for a six. Clears the short boundary
back of a length offcutter just outside off, whipped away towards deep square leg
even shorter, incutter, sticks in the surface. He attempts a flick and inside-edges it onto the pad
hung up in the air outside off, 86ks, forced away to long-on
another floaty offcutter, shortish, whipped away on the back foot to deep midwicket
Henriques shuffles across off, fetches a length ball and dumps it over square leg with a slog-sweep
short legbreak outside off, slashes a cut to the left of sweeper cover
lobbed up very full and outside off, Klinger lays into a drive, and sends the ball clattering away to the left of the covers
slower and angled in on off, then turns, the batsman gets forward and plays it back to the bowler
pitched up and outside off, eased to long-off
slower and dips outside off, Henriques can't get close to the pitch. He slogs and drags an inside edge to short fine leg
flatter and speared outside off, a back-foot force to cover ensures
slower ball, 113ks, grips and cuts away outside off, beats the groping bat
length and outside off, whipped away to deep midwicket
shortish and outside off, leans back and cuts to point
112.5ks slower full ball on middle and leg, worked along the ground to deep midwicket
113.8ks back of a length on off, the batsman was waiting on the back foot for it. Clipped through square leg

Kapugedara drops it running to his right at long-on. What's more? The ball plonks behind to the boundary. Slower full ball on the off stump, Henriques skips out and skies a loft. He was hoodwinked by the lack of pace. Kapu runs across and makes a royal mess of it in the deep
short and wide outside off, cut to the left of sweeper cover

a big appeal for caught behind from the bowler and the keeper. Nogajski takes his own sweet time and then raises his finger. Good length and outside off, Klinger reaches out with his hands, swishes and snicks behind. The snicko detects the outside edge. End of a sluggish knock from Klinger
back of a length on off, Head drops it straight to point and sets off. Henriques responded quickly too
short of a length on off, hops and jabs the ball in the direction of square leg
full and outside off, driven on the front foot to the left of extra cover. Prasanna swoops down on the ball but can't under-arm it onto the stumps. Had he hit Head would have been caught short
floated full and outside off, slower one past the tramline. Off-side wide
short of a length on off, punched away to wide long-on, where Asela fumbles now

Munaweera misjudges a skier at short third man. Good length and angling away outside off, Head eyes up a leg-side slog and ends up top-edging it into the sky. Munaweera at short third man turns to his left instead of turning to his right and Sri Lanka drop another catch. Think Munaweera did not even get his hand to it. Their fielding is going to pieces
The drop costs Sri Lanka nothing. Munaweera will be relieved. Length and angling away outside off, bounces at the batsman. Head simply steers it into the gloves of Dickwella
short of a length and outside off, stabs an inside edge for one
slower back of a length ball on off, nudged square of short fine leg for one
pitched up and outside off, driven through the covers
full and outside off, gets forward and pushes through the off side again
full and outside off, slogged away to deep midwicket
dug in short and outside off, skips back and square-cuts it away for a couple. Good running
fuller legbreak outside off, forced away wide of point
full-toss outside off, hacked away to wide long-on
fired outside off, spins away, catches the outside edge and sneaks away fine of short third man. Three runs. Another example of good running from this pair

Excellent catch from Siriwardana at long-off. Starkly contrasts with those drops from Kapu and Munaweera. Tossed up and spins away outside off, Turner flat-bats this legbreak in the air. Siriwardana moves swiftly to his right, dives across, and snaps it up
slower short ball outside off, dinked with soft hands to point
short of a length and outside off, thrashes a cut to sweeper cover
Henriques gallops down the track. Malinga digs it into the middle of the pitch. Slammed away over the top. Up and over extra-cover, beats long-off to his left
full cutter on off, nudged away to midwicket
full and sliding into the leg stump, edged away towards point

114.1ks slower dipping yorker from Malinga. How does he do that? Slings in on middle, dips and kisses the front pad. Nogajski rules him out.  Hotspot picks up an inside edge. Faulkner has to go, though
slower short ball on off stump, hip-high ball, moves back and swats it powerfully over midwicket
short and outside off, dragged to deep midwicket
half-volley outside off, chipped in the air to the left of long-off. What a way to get off the mark, Paine. He fell for a duck without facing a ball in the previous game
back of a length and outside off, opens the bat-face and glides to point
Henriques comes down the track and is cramped for room. He manages to push the ball to long-on. Just a single
slower incutter from the front of the hand, the batsman waits for the ball to arrive and works to leg
full on middle and leg, flicked through midwicket. Rushes back for the second and acknowledges his fifty, which was boosted Australia
118.3ks, slower dipping leg-stump yorker, squeezed back to the bowler

Malinga implores, Paine given out lbw. Another slower full ball from Malinga. Dips in front of Paine, who was shaping up for a cute little scoop over Dickwella's head. He is pinned in front. Second wicket for Malinga. It was crashing into leg stump. The ball looped off the pad into the gloves of the keeper
118.8ks dipping full-toss, tapped away past Malinga's left. He hunts the ball down. Nearly connects with a direct hit
118ks slower and outside off, the batsman uses his feet and carves to point
full on the stumps, dragged to wide long-on
very full on the leg stump, pushed down to long-on, they take on Kapu's arm for two
uses his feet, meets a half-volley and slices to point. Straight to the man

Kulasekara can bowl yorkers too. Yorker, tails in late into the leg stump. Pings the toe and disturbs the leg stump. Too good for a lower-order batsman. It would have even dismissed a top-order batsman
leg-stump ball, deflected away off the pad very fine of Malinga at long leg. He slides in vain. Four leg byes

appeal for lbw, Simon Fry now raises his finger. Full and swerves in to beat the inside edge - Tye was looking to work it across the line - traps him in front of leg. But I guess this was heading down leg

bowled'em. Kulaseakara closes the innings with a wicket. Very full on the leg stump, kisses the pad and hits the stumps. Richardson does not connect with the wild slog. He bags a golden duck on debut. Three wickets in four balls from Kulasekara
Dickwella uses his feet, does not meet this full-toss coming from around the wicket, hits the front pad, heading down leg
tossed up and angled in on middle, played back to the bowler
floaty full ball outside off, Tharanga steps out and lifts it nice and clean over mid-off
Tharanga steps away outside leg, the bowler follows him and cramps him. Chopped to cover

Turner strikes in his first over. Arm ball on middle, no turn. Tharanga slogs it in the air and offers catching practice to debutant Richardson at deep midwicket. Just two fielders outside the ring and Tharanga picked out Richardson to perfection
pushed through outside off, another arm ball, Munaweera wafts and misses searching for the turn
back of a length and angling away outside off, 139ks. Bounces at Dickwella. He jumps outside leg and slashes it over the top of slip. The outside edge flies away
length ball on leg stump, steps away outside leg and plays a jabbing punch to cover
Dickwella moves away outside leg, dug short and cramps Dickwella. He manages to upper-cut it wide of backward point
shortish and zings onto the batsman, 143ks, Dickwella is beaten for pace. He hooks and sends a top-edge flying over the keeper now
121ks short slower ball on middle, backs away and glides it to point. A direct hit at the striker's end could have had Dickwella. He plonked his bat onto the turf and it got jarred. Dickwella escapes
back of a length on middle, backs away outside leg and smears it over cover-point
Dickwells steps away outside leg again, short and outside off. He nearly dragged it back onto the stumps, attempting a cut

Dickwella attempts the scoop and the ball balloons into the gloves of the keeper. It bounces more than Dickwella expected. He pre-meditates, going low, and attempting to dink it over his shoulder. The ball misses the bat, misses the glove, grazes the shoulder on its way to Paine
shortish on middle and leg, Mendis is tucked up for room. Played back to the bowler
dragged short and wide outside off, scythed away to deep point
dug in short and outside off, pulled away to deep square leg. Tye hunts the ball down, slides on his stomach and makes a smart save. Just two runs
back of a length and angled in, 140.8ks, played back to the bowler
back of a length on off, that one hurried onto Mendis, who aimed to open the bat-face and punch to cover. The ball squirts away

Third-ball wicket for Richardson on debut. His team-mates mess his hair up. Back of a length and outside off, skids through in the corridor. Mendis swishes a long way away from hid body and nicks it behind. The outside edge flies to the right of Paine. He stretches across and completes a fine catch
length ball on off, defended back to the bowler
139.8ks, hits the deck hard, takes the outside edge and rolls away towards point
back of a length and outside off, 142ks, Asela, having backed away outside leg, flat-bats it fiercely through cover
short ball on the leg stump, pulled flat and hard over short fine leg for six. These boundaries are pretty short

length ball on off, bursts off the deck and leaves Munaweera in a tangle. Chest-high ball, Munaweera throws his gloves in front of his face. The ball takes the glove and Paine grabs another smart catch to his right. SL four down for 40
Two wickets in two balls for Tye. Another batsman has been bounced out. Back of a length and jumps at Siriwardana, cramping him for room. He cuts tamely, and finds backward point
back of a length and outside off, Kapu lets it go
full and angled in on off, worked away towards square leg. Kapu collides with Tye, the bowler isn't pleased
full and just a shade outside off, defended back to the bowler
back of a length and kicks up outside off, takes the edge near the top of the bat but does not carry to Finch at slip. This guy is hitting the deck hard. Kapu wrings his hands in pain
just short of a good length and outside off, chopped away to deep point
139.6ks, back of a length and outside off, cushioned into the covers with soft hands
140.5ks, good length and angled in on middle, dabbed towards mid-on
slower full ball outside off, the batsman picks it, opens the face and runs it down to third man with soft hands
back of a length and slower outside off, glided off the face to point
111ks offcutter on off, Asela gets a taste of his own medicine. Worked with soft hands to midwicket
leg-stump ball, kisses the pad and rolls away fine past the keeper. Oh, he had managed an inside edge onto the pad
back of a length on off, stays back and clips towards midwicket
off-stump yorker, angled down towards third man
length ball just outside off, opens the face and eases a single down to third man
very full and slow outside off, firmly driven on the front foot to cover, where there is a fumble
dragged down outside off, pulled over midwicket, the protection is at the deep
skids on outside off, no turn, Asela plays across the line and is hit on the pad outside off
slides on flatter and faster outside off, Kapu goes low and drags a hard sweep to the square leg boundary
looped up and outside off, gets forward and drills it straight over the bowler's head for another boundary
length ball offbreak, punched down to long-on
length and outside off, guides to point
mighty full on off stump, shovelled away to wide long-on
very full on off, whipped away stylishly to deep square leg
118.2ks slower short ball outside off, cut away behind square on the off side
pitched up on middle, Asela rolls his wrists and clips it away with the angle to deep square leg
116.7ks slower ball outside off, Kapu had no clue about this. Swinging early and missing
hip-high short ball on the leg stump, Asela hangs back and shovels it away to deep square leg

fractionally short on the off stump, Asela picks it up and flicks over midwicket. Turner expected the ball to move further to his right, it doesn't, and he is beaten to his left as the ball skips away to the boundary
length ball on off, dabbed with soft hands towards point
another short ball on off, which is pulled in the direction of deep square
offcutter, pitched on leg stump and goes over the top of off. Beaten
dug short and outside off, pulled firmly to deep midwicket on the back foot
very full on middle, moves in, stays back and whips straight to midwicket
slower back of the hand slower ball, legcutter, Kapu swings early and skews it in the air to the right of long-on
another offcutter, from the front of the hand, 109ks, dips late and beats the swish
slower and short outside off, guided with soft hands to point
106ks legcutter outside off, Asela swivels on the back foot, reads the slower one and pulls it in the air square of short fine leg
legcutter short and wide outside off, slashed away to deep point for one
slower short ball on the off stump, nails a pull to deep midwicket
seam-up length ball outside off, ventures across off, misses a shovel-pull and takes it on the thigh
short and kicks up outside off, beats the swish outside off. Bounces up and over the swinging bat
shortish and outside off, chopped out to point
slightly back of a length and outside of, dabs a cut to third man
short and outside off, backs away outside leg and upper-cuts it to third man
slower short ball outside off, slashes hard and sends a big top edge to the right of Paine
Cummins rolls his fingers across this slower short ball. Kapu slashes early and misses the front of the hand offcutter

Well-judged catch from Dunk running across to his right from mid-off and completing an overhead catch. Good length ball on middle and off, Kapu looks to loft it over the fielder. He does not time it well enough as the bat twists in his hands
back of a length and fizzes over the stumps, backs away, cuts and misses
slower short ball outside off, shovel-pulled away to long leg
136.8ks bouncer outside off, flies off the deck, beats the hook.  Too high. Wide
dug short and outside off, slashed away to deep third man again
length and outside off, Asela shuffles across, gets inside the line and pulls over the short fine leg fence. The fielder was very square
Asela beats Dunk again, this time to his left. Short and fast on middle, pulled away. Dunk can't even get his finger-tips to the ball
fullish and outside off, helped down to third man
length and outside off, jabbed into the covers
short and outside off, guided down to third man for two
full on off, played back to the bowler
short and outside off, rears off the deck, beats the ugly swish
full cutter drifting down leg, off the thigh and rolls to the keeper.  Given as a wide, though
Asela dashes down the track. This is short and wide outside off. He is forced to reach out for the ball, but can't touch it
bail-high short ball on off, swiped away more or less straight to midwicket
back of a length and thuds into the splice of the bat before dropping on the pitch
back of a length and angled in, knocked towards square leg
short ball on the leg stump, probably the back of the hand slower one. Asela lines it up and pulls away fine of long leg. Fine start to the over for Sri Lanka

Holes out to Head at long leg running in and sliding on his knees. Throat-high short ball, seam-up, cramps Prasanna for room. He attempts another hook and falls this time with Head gulping down the top edge
slower ball, 111.1ks, jumps over the stumps as Asela backs away and misses
Asela shows his ace early by stepping away outside leg. Faulkner chases him with a shortish ball, which is flapped away to midwicket
slower full-toss on the leg stump, which is punched away to wide long-on
Asela is floored. He backs away outside leg, Faulkner goes very full and wide outside off. The batsman reaches out, loses his balance, tumbles but gets it fine on the off side
full, a yorker in fact on off, jammed onto the pitch
short and wide outside off past the tramline, not called a wide. Faulkner gets away. That was left alone by Asela
full offcutter outside off or the knuckle ball, sliced it off the outside half over backward point
fullish and on off, Asela eyes up the leg side with a big swipe, the ball takes the bottom edge and wanders away to fine leg
110ks very slow and outside off, Kula is through with the big shot well before the ball arrived
full-toss on off stump, Kulasekara aims a loft but toe-ends it in front of long-on
slower yorker on the leg stump, back of the hand ball, the batsman backs away, and jams to cover
Asela ventures across off stump, takes a back of a length ball on the leg stump and swats it away to deep square leg
Kulasekara sits back deep in the crease, this is really full on off. Kulasekara gets under it and lofts it over cover
Kulasekara backs away outside leg, Faulkner follows him with a fullish ball. Deflected fine on the leg side for four
dropped short and outside off, Kulasekara hammers it away to deep cover
slower ball outside leg following the batsman, gloved behind to the keeper
very full on off, Asela wants to smite this over midwicket. He only manages an inside edge onto the pad. The shot was on, the execution was bad with Asela losing his shape
pretty full and outside off, Asela lines this up, clears his front leg, and lofts it over cover for a six. Clean swing, back-to-back fifties for Asela
back of a length and outside off, wrong length again. Asela clears his front leg again, slamming it high over midwicket
three sixes in a row for Asela. Length ball on off stump, Asela short-arm swats it over square leg now. The exploded from the middle of the bat. He is keeping SL alive in the chase
slower offcutter outside off, Asela swipes early and misses. Beaten by the change of pace
back of a length and outside off, Asela makes sweet connection again. Lofts it flat over cover now. 22 runs off the over

Kulasekara holes out. Has he crossed over to the other end? Knuckle ball, slow and outside off, Kula aims to go over cover. He only toe-ends it into the air. Klinger completes a fine overhead catch at extra-cover
full-toss on off stump, Asela lifts it over mid-off who is inside the circle. Tye erred in length and was punished
Asela clears mid-off, again. Goes all the way. Good length and outside off, hoisted flat over the fielder. What a key strike
very full and on off, whipped away to deep square leg. Sri Lanka settle with one
short of a length on middle, seam-up ball, Malinga hangs back and shovel-pulls over midwicket. There is protection in the deep. There was probably two on offer, SL settle with one. Over to Asela

Asela Gunaratne wins it for Sri Lanka. He does it in style! For the second time in three days Sri Lanka secure a last-ball win. They secure their third successive T20 series win in Australia. Seam-up length ball outside off, Asela backs away outside leg and hammers it over cover to spark wild celebrations in the Sri Lankan camp
